intro: Deanea longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract sterculia, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically large and lobed, and its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces woody capsules as fruit, which contain numerous small, flat seeds. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
